articles.author: Akash Sriram
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened once again on Friday to ramp up his trade war, recommending a 50% tariff on European Union goods starting June 1 and warning Apple he may impose a 25% tariff on any iPhones manufactured outside the U.S.
articles.title: Trump's renewed trade threats take aim at European Union, Apple

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Harvard University sued the Trump administration on Friday over its decision to revoke the Ivy League school's ability to enroll foreign students, ratcheting up White House efforts to conform practices in academia to President Donald Trump's policies.
articles.title: Harvard sues Trump administration for blocking enrollment of foreign students

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital Kyiv early on Saturday with drones and missiles, triggering fires, strewing debris in districts throughout the city and injuring at least eight people, the city's mayor said.
articles.title: Kyiv mayor says Russian drones, missiles trigger fires, injure eight

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, John Irish
articles.description: Iranian and U.S. negotiators will resume talks on Friday in Rome to resolve a decades-long dispute over Tehran's nuclear ambitions, despite Iran's supreme leader warning that clinching a new deal might be insurmountable amid clashing red lines.
articles.title: US and Iran to hold nuclear talks amid clashing red lines

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mahmoud Issa
articles.description: Mervat Hijazi and her nine children didn't eat at all on Thursday - save her underweight baby who had a sachet of peanut paste.
articles.title: Diary of a Gazan family's descent toward starvation

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Simon Lewis
articles.description: The United States on Friday took the first steps toward lifting sanctions on Syria after President Donald Trump said his administration would unwind them.
articles.title: US takes first steps that ease sanctions on Syria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine expect to release about 1,000 prisoners from each side.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine swap 307 soldiers on second day of POW exchange

articles.author: Cassandra Garrison
articles.description: Critics say Mexico's ambitious judicial reform risks removing checks on the ruling Morena party and allowing organized-crime groups greater influence over the judicial system.
articles.title: El Chapo's former lawyer and an ex-drug smuggler are on the ballot to be judges in Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australian authorities started clean-up efforts on Saturday after floods claimed five lives and inundated more than 10,000 properties in the country's southeast.
articles.title: Australia begins clean-up after floods kill 5, damage 10,000 properties

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that a major prisoner swap was just completed between Russia and Ukraine.
articles.title: Trump says major prisoner swap completed between Russia-Ukraine
